note.title: ECE 250 â€“ Algorithms and Data Structures
note.content:
### ğŸ“š Concepts

**I. Foundational Concepts & Analysis**
- Algorithm basics and systematic development
- Complexity analysis and Big-O notation
- C++ programming fundamentals
- Linux environment and command line tools

**II. Abstract Data Types (ADTs) and Linear Data Structures**
- Abstraction principles and ADT implementation
- Queues (FIFO), Stacks (LIFO), Sets, and Maps
- Linked Lists: singly, doubly, and circular variations
- Efficiency tradeoffs in basic operations

**III. Hierarchical Data Structures (Trees)**
- Tree terminology and traversal methods
- Binary Search Trees (BSTs) and operations
- Self-balancing trees: AVL and Red-Black Trees
- Heaps, Priority Queues, and their operations

**IV. Associative Structures (Hash Tables)**
- Hash table fundamentals and collision handling
- Hash functions and load factor management
- Collision resolution: external chaining and probing

**V. Sorting Algorithms**
- O(NÂ²) algorithms: Bubble, Selection, Insertion Sort
- O(NlogN) algorithms: Merge, Quick, Heap Sort
- Non-comparison sorting: Radix Sort
- Sorting properties: stability and adaptivity

**VI. Graph Theory and Algorithms**
- Graph ADT and implementations (adjacency matrix/list)
- Graph search: DFS and BFS
- Shortest path algorithms: Dijkstra's
- Minimum Spanning Tree: Prim's and Kruskal's

**VII. Algorithm Design Paradigms**
- Brute Force and Greedy Algorithms
- Divide and Conquer approach
- Dynamic Programming and memoization

### ğŸ”— Backlinks

- [[Red-Black Trees]]

- [[Graph Algorithms]]
- [[Dynamic Programming]]
- [[Greedy Algorithms]]

sourceNote.title: ğŸ« University of Waterloo
sourceNote.content:
### ğŸ“ Bachelor of Computer Engineering

## ğŸ“˜ 1A Term
- COMMST 192 â€“ Communication in the Engineering Profession
- ECE 105 â€“ Classical Mechanics
- ECE 150 â€“ Fundamentals of Programming
- ECE 190 â€“ Engineering Profession and Practice
- ECE 198 â€“ Project Studio
- MATH 115 â€“ Linear Algebra for Engineering
- MATH 117 â€“ Calculus I for Engineering

## ğŸ“— 1B Term
- ECE 106 â€“ Electricity and Magnetism
- ECE 108 â€“ Discrete Mathematics and Logic 1
- ECE 124 â€“ Digital Circuits and Systems
- ECE 140 â€“ Linear Circuits
- ECE 192 â€“ Engineering Economics and Impact on Society
- MATH 119 â€“ Calculus II for Engineering

## ğŸ“™ 2A Term
- [[ECE 109 â€“ Materials Chemistry for Engineers]]
- [[ECE 204 â€“ Numerical Methods]]
- [[ECE 205 â€“ Advanced Calculus 1 for Electrical and Computer Engineers]]
- [[ECE 222 â€“ Digital Computers]]
- [[ECE 240 â€“ Electronic Circuits 1]]
- [[ECE 250 â€“ Algorithms and Data Structures]]

## ğŸ§© PD Courses
- PD 19 â€“ Tactics for Workplace Success
- PD 20 â€“ Strategies for Career Success
- PD 10 â€“ Professional Responsibility in Computing
- PD 22 â€“ Professionalism and Ethics in Engineering Practice

## ğŸŒ± Reflections from My Journey
Build systems for yourself â€” good habits compound.
Learn how to learn. Spend real time thinking about how to understand things deeply and meaningfully.

Always ask yourself why you're doing something. What kind of life do I want to live after university?

There will be moments in university when you feel lonely. Don't stay in bed â€” step outside.

Every experience and every choice shapes who I am. Donâ€™t be afraid â€” just try.

We live in a world of constant change, and we never know when it will shift. If I accept that anything in my life can change unexpectedly, then decisions become less scary. What matters most is having the confidence that whatever happens, I'll adapt and find my way again.

### ğŸš€ My Approach to Internships
There's nothing more certain than actually trying something. Being inside an organization reveals sides of myself I didn't know existed. That's why I shouldn't assume beforehand what I will or won't enjoy.

### ğŸ¯ Reminder to myself
Don't waste energy debating whether a choice is right or wrong. **Make the choice right by the way you commit to it.**
